member.name: T:MvcContrib.Filters.ModelStateToTempDataAttribute
member.summary: When a RedirectToRouteResult is returned from an action, anything in the ViewData.ModelState dictionary will be copied into TempData. When a ViewResultBase is returned from an action, any ModelState entries that were previously copied to TempData will be copied back to the ModelState dictionary.

member.summary: This was copied from System.Web.Mvc.RouteCollectionExtensions and modified slightly. The original function declares the defaults and constraints parameters as object type, which causes the wrong overload of RouteValueDictionary to be invoked, causing values in the dictionaries not to be set properly. The modified version declares these parameters as Dictionary<string, object>, fixing the problem.

member.name: M:MvcContrib.Routing.RegexRoute.GetVirtualPath(System.Web.Routing.RequestContext,System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary)
member.summary: Used to get a virtual path for a given set of route settings. If the combination of defaults/values doesn't satisfy the url generator tokens: null is returned, signaling that this route isn't correct for the given values.
member.remarks: This function is not used for figuring out the routes. It is only used for generating links for new routes.
member.param: The request context.
The settings to use to generate this virtual path.
member.returns: A virtual path that represents the given settings.

member.name: M:MvcContrib.Routing.RegexRoute.GetRouteData(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary: Gets the route data from an incoming request; parses the incoming virtual path and returns the route data that was inside the url.
member.param: The HTTP context containing the url data.
member.returns: Route data gleaned from the context.

member.name: M:MvcContrib.Routing.RegexRoute.GetRouteData(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the route data from the request portion of the url.
member.param: The request string (the part after the virtual directory but before the query string).
member.returns: Route data gleaned from the context.

member.summary: Gets the default route value dictionary containing the default route settings.
member.value: The default settings for this route.

member.value: The route handler that handles this route.

member.summary: By default, the DataList displays the items in a single column, However, you can specify any number of columns.

example.code: Html.DataList(_dataSource) .NumberOfColumns(3) .RepeatHorizontally() .CellTemplate(x => { Writer.Write(x.ToLower()); }) .CellCondition(x => x == "test1") .EmptyDateSourceTemplate(() => { Writer.Write("There is no data available."); }) .NoItemTemplate(() => { Writer.Write("No Data."); });

member.name: T:MvcContrib.Services.IEmailTemplateService
member.summary: Service to render MailMessages from MVC views.

member.name: M:MvcContrib.Services.IEmailTemplateService.RenderMessage(System.String,MvcContrib.Services.EmailMetadata,System.Web.Mvc.ControllerContext)
member.summary: Generates an instance of a MailMessage from the given view and metadata.
member.param: Name of the view that contain email subject and email body. The first line of the view is considered subject, everything else is body.
Mail addresses "to", "from", "cc" and other metadata about the email.
The context for view rendering.
member.returns: Returns a MailMessage ready for sending out.

member.name: T:MvcContrib.Services.EmailTemplateService.EmailDetails
member.summary:
The only information that comes from the email template is subject and body.
Everything else ("to", "from", etc) is known when we call the service. But subject/body are localizable and can contain placeholders - so they need to get fetched from the email template view.

summary.para: A Restful fluent controller to standardise the design of controllers and ease the burden of testing.
If you need Dependency Injection (and you might want to for repositories) do so in your own constructor.

member.name: T:MvcContrib.Filters.PredicatePreconditionFilter
member.author: Troy DeMonbreun
member.summary: This is an action attribute that defines (via a predicate method) a required RouteData or Request parameter "precondition" for the action. On precondition failure, the specified Exception type will be thrown. More info here.

member.summary: Attribute constructor

Type of key to validate
Predicate<object> method that encapsulates validation logic
Exception to throw on failed validation

member.summary: Signals failure if RouteData key does not exist, RouteData key value is null, or predicate evaluates to false
